oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-08-29 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from September 29, 1959. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer) with his Rainbow Ranch Boys, guest performer Floyd Tillman, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, the Jordanaires, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1038th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Rainbow Ranch Boys; Archie Campbell; Floyd Tillman; Tommy Jackson; Jordanaires; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hank Snow -- The Last Ride (Hank Snow and his Rainbow Ranch Boys) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Grant Turner introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell, Hank Snow) -- Grant Turner and Hank Snow introduce Floyd Tillman -- I Love You So Much It Hurts (Floyd Tillman) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Grant Turner introduces Tommy Jackson -- Bill Cheatham (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Grant Turner and Hank Snow talk -- He'll Understand And Say Well Done (Hank Snow, Jordanaires) -- Hank Snow introduces Chet Atkins -- Bicycle Built For Two (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Campbell, Archie; Minnie Pearl; Jackson, Tommy; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jordanaires (Musical group); Snow, Hank; Rainbow Ranch Boys; Tillman, Floyd
